p: The present study considered 7 grapevine varieties, both international (5 varieties), Merlot (M), Cabernet Sauvignon (CS), Cabernet Franc (CF), Chardonnay (CH), Sangiovese (S) and autochthonous (2 varieties), Aleatico (A) [ 67], and the native Grechetto di Orvieto (GR) [ 52]. These varieties are representative of the amphelographic base of the central Italy oenological products. The white varieties (CH and GR) were predominant in the western sub-area; red varieties (M, CS, CF, S, and GR) were concentrated in the eastern one.
